title: Servicetekniker
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
description:
**Till kontoret i Upplands Väsby söker vi** 




**Servicetekniker Dental Utrustning/Stockholm** 




  





 Vi söker Sveriges trevligaste servicetekniker!
 



 DAB Dental AB behöver förstärka vår serviceorganisation i Stockholm. Serviceavdelningen ingår i affärsområdet teknisk service. Hos oss på DAB får du ca 70 nya trevliga arbetskamrater varav 35 på Serviceavdelningen.
 



 Vi har en bra arbetsmiljö med mycket skratt och värme. Vi söker dig som är positiv och utåtriktad och har en mycket god känsla för kvalitet och service. Vi erbjuder ett fritt och stimulerande arbete där du dagligen arbetar i direkt kontakt med våra kunder och leverantörer.
 



  





**Kort om jobbet:** 




 Du är vårt ansikte utåt och i arbetet ingår att serva, reparera och underhålla dental utrustning ute hos våra kunder.
 



 Utbildning sker hos tillverkare (både i Sverige och utomlands) samt även internt. Du utgår ifrån hemmet och lämplig bostadsort för tjänsten är i Stockholm. Övernattningar förekommer.
 



 Kontakter med leverantörer angående reservdelar och teknisk dokumentation sker på svenska och engelska.
 



  





**Din profil:** 




 En bra bakgrund är någon form av el-utbildning, styr och regler eller erfarenhet från arbete med
 



 produkter innehållande el, luft och vatten. Har du erfarenhet av dental utrustning är detta en fördel.
 



 Vi förutsätter att du har IT kompetens och talar svenska och engelska. Det är viktigt att du är serviceinriktad och förstår kundens behov. Sist men inte minst, att du är en glad och positiv person. Körkort är ett krav.
 



  





**Anställningsform:** 




 Tillsvidare, heltid. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
 



  





**Intresserad?** 




 Skicka in din CV och ett personligt brev till
 



 Anders Morell, Service och valideringschef
 



 anders.morell@dabdental.se
 



 Telefon +46 8 506 505 19
 



 Mobil +46 708 59 34 22
 



  





 Vi kommer träffa kandidater löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
 



 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 







  





***OM DAB***




*DAB Dental AB startades 1903 och är idag en marknadsledare i Sverige inom distribution av medicintekniska produkter till tandvården. I sortimentet ingår allt tandvården behöver i form av förbrukningsartiklar, utrustning samt tekniska tjänster. DAB Dental har ca 80 anställda och kontor i Stockholm, Malmö, Linköping, Falun, Göteborg samt ett showroom centralt i Stockholm.* 




*Bolaget omsätter ca 350 Mkr och ingår i börsnoterade Lifco AB. Inom Lifco AB finns ett 100-tal bolag som har ca 200 000 tandläkare, sköterskor och hygienister som kunder varje år. Lifco AB är expansivt och omsätter totalt ca 8 miljarder SEK.*

title: Young Potential Trainee Program - IT, Tech and Digitalisation
description:
We’re looking for curious, driven people who want to help shape a better tomorrow. At Scania, we’re on a mission to make transport more sustainable — for businesses, society, and the planet.
   

  

 Do you want to be a part of it?
   

  

**About Us**
 We believe great leadership starts with learning and collaboration. “The Scania Way” is our culture — built on values, openness, and trust. Here, you’ll be encouraged to grow, take ownership, and use your unique strengths to make a real impact.
   

  

 If you want to know more about our work culture you can find more information here: Diversity and inclusion | Scania Group
   

  

 We also offer a wide range of employee benefits, which you can read more about here: Scania Offers
   

  

**The Program**
 Embark on a 15-month journey of growth, leadership, and global experience—starting 17th of August 2026 at our Head Office in Södertälje.
   

  

**Here’s what awaits you:**
* A full-time position from day one Your home base will likely be one of our Södertälje offices, with flexibility for remote work depending on your role and preferences.
* Four dynamic rotations across Scania—both in Sweden and internationally Gain hands-on experience through four 2–3 month assignments in diverse departments, including cross-brand collaboration and a Scania Distributor rotation.
* Nine weeks of immersive leadership training Develop your leadership mindset through tailored sessions designed to elevate your impact and confidence with a strong foundation in the Scania Leadership Principle's.
* Collaborative projects and networking with fellow trainees Work on real-world challenges and build lasting connections with peers across the organization.
* A dedicated mentor to guide your development Receive personalized support and insights from an experienced leader throughout your journey.
* Shared projects and network assignments with your trainee year group Strengthen teamwork and broaden your perspective through joint initiatives.
* A program where you take the lead Shape your own path with the support of your mentor and managers—your growth, your way


 You’ll get to explore Scania and the TRATON GROUP, build global connections, and learn how to lead yourself — and others — with purpose.
   

  

**Our Future Trainee**
 You’re into leadership and want to keep evolving. You care about sustainability and want to help us push that even further. Most of all, you’re excited to work with others and make amazing things happen.
   

  

**Minimum requirements to apply for the Young Potential Trainee Program 2026:**
* You hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in related areas within the area of IT, Tech and Digitalisation.
* You have graduated between 2024 and the summer of 2026.
* You have a maximum of 2 years of professional experience within your field of studies at the start of the program.
* You speak and write English fluently and other languages are seen as an advantage.
* You must be an EU/EES citizen or hold a permanent residence permit in Sweden to comply with migration laws, due to the fact that some assignments during the program will take place outside of Sweden for a minimum of three months.


 In addition to meeting the minimum requirements, we value candidates who bring extra drive and initiative. Previous leadership experience in student unions, sports clubs, housing associations or similar organizations is highly appreciated, as it shows your ability to take responsibility and inspire others. Having worked part-time in areas such as project management, event coordination, or customer service is also a strong asset. These experiences reflect your ability to collaborate, communicate, and adapt in dynamic environments. Whether you've led a team, organized an event, or supported customers, you've already demonstrated key skills that will help you thrive in our trainee program. We’re looking for individuals who take initiatives and enjoy working with others to make things happen.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
 To ensure a smooth and fair selection process,
 **it’s important that you are ready and available online on the specified dates.** 
 All steps will be conducted digitally, and unfortunately, we are unable to offer individual time slots or alternative dates. Your participation during the scheduled times is essential for us to move forward effectively.
   

  

  

* Online Tests: 7–11 January 2026 If selected, the recruitment process begins with a web-based psychometric test who are designed to ensure an unbiased and fair screening. These tests will be sent to all applicants who meet our basic requirements and help us assess your potential and suitability for the program.
* Interviews: 22–29 January 2026 If selected, you’ll be invited to a 45–60-minute digital interview where we explore your professional interests and personal competencies.
* Assessment Days: 10 or 11 February 2026 If selected, you’ll be invited to one of these dates for a full-day online assessment depending on the business area.


 We begin by reviewing your test results, followed by your CV, formal education, and previous experience. A background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

**Application**
 A complete application includes CV and a summary of grade records or your degree certificate. If you currently study outside of Sweden or have a foreign degree from your highest studies, you need to get your degree verified by the Swedish Council for Higher Education. Please visit https://www.uhr.se/ to get recognition for your foreign qualifications. Note that this process can take up to six months. Incomplete applications will not be processed.
   

  

 For questions regarding the program or the process please contact: trainee@scania.com.
   

  

 Please apply to the area of competence that suits your interests and profile, there is one job ad for each business area. When you apply, only choose one business area. Otherwise, we will not be able to handle your application. Learn more about the different Business Areas and the program
 **HERE.**
***Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-01-06. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period.***
 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: CRM Data Scientist (18 months Temporary Role)
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a CRM Data Scientist within the Loyalty & CRM team under Market Activation, you will be at the forefront of recruiting, onboarding and developing customers through our loyalty and membership program. In this global role, your contributions will have a direct and significant impact on our brand strategy.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Analyzing customer data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in CRM strategies.
* Building predictive models to forecast customer behavior and preferences.
* Developing and implement machine learning algorithms to enhance customer segmentation, targeting, and personalization efforts.
* Collaborating with the CRM team and the Value stream to design and execute A/B tests and experiments.
* Creating data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
* Continuously monitoring and evaluating the performance of CRM initiatives and recommend adjustments as needed.
* Staying up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data science and CRM.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 The Marketing Activation Unit within Marketing is tasked with creating a strategic plan that brings our brand direction to life across various touchpoints. Leveraging data and customer insights, we design comprehensive plans that ensure a seamless and holistic customer experience.
   

  

 Loyalty is built through every aspect of our company, from the products we create and the brand we represent to the experiences we offer. When we talk about ‘Loyalty’, we leverage two key enablers to inform our strategies and tactics: our Membership program and our CRM capabilities.
   

  

 Membership ensures identification and engagement of our member base, building a direct relationship with our customers. Through CRM activities, we increase the value of customer interactions and drive positive customer base development, generating incremental sales.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 To thrive in this role, you bring strong analytical thinking, excellent communication skills, and a collaborative mindset. You’re comfortable working in fast-paced environments, translating complex data into actionable insights, and contributing meaningfully to cross-functional teams. You’re confident presenting your ideas and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders and are eager to grow your impact through hands-on work and continuous learning.
   

  

*We’re looking for candidates who have:*
* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* 3–5 years of experience in data analysis, machine learning, and working with CRM systems.
* Proficiency in Python and SQL, with the ability to write clean, production-ready code and participate in code reviews.
* Applied knowledge in statistics and machine learning, including model evaluation and optimization.
* Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and version control systems like Git.
* Strong communication skills to present insights and ML solutions to diverse audiences.
* A proactive approach to working independently while collaborating effectively within cross-functional product teams.


*And people who are:*
* Hands-on with customer segmentation, churn prediction, and recommendation systems.
* Familiar with CRM platforms such as Adobe, Salesforce, or HubSpot.
* Experienced with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP) and big data tools (e.g., Spark, Hadoop).
* Able to translate business problems into machine learning solutions and define appropriate evaluation metrics.
* Interested in contributing to Communities of Practice or mentoring junior colleagues as part of your growth journey.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

 Our commitment to an inclusive workplace drives our dynamic and forward-thinking culture. Regardless of your background, origin, or preferences, your application is warmly welcomed. We value diverse perspectives and skills, and every applicant contributes to our vibrant, creative community. Join us and be part of the future we're building.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

**This role is based out of Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Please note: This is a temporary position for 18 months, ending in May 2027**

title: Technical Recruiter
description:
TEKsystems’® unmatched success in the IT Services and Talent Management marketplace is driven by one thing – our employees. A thriving IT industry has caused us to grow at a rapid pace and we are looking for people to join our team. We offer great opportunities for advancement, personal and professional growth, and unlimited earning potential.
 



  





 TEKsystems® seeks professional individuals with competitive spirit, drive, team mentality, commitment, perseverance, and a desire to build a long-term career in a rewarding environment.
 



  





**What you will contribute:** 



* Recruit top IT candidates and serve as the main point of contact throughout the entire recruiting cycle.
* Build and maintain relationships with consultants to match them with the BEST opportunities.
* Evaluate experience and opportunities of candidates through our screening process.
* Understand our clients’ business and IT initiatives, as well as their specific technical and cultural environments to best match the career goals of consultants with their hiring needs.
* Negotiate unique compensation packages (wages, benefits, etc.) to attract and hire candidates for our clients’ needs.



**What you bring to the table:** 



* Interest in a performance-based environment including outbound calling.
* Enthusiasm to network and communicate with others.
* Grit, tenacity, and determination.



**Extra Points if you have:** 



* Previous sales/recruiting experience (Internships included)
* Experience working in a performance-driven environment



**The Opportunity** 



* Growth potential with various career paths for recruiters and sales professionals
* An elite and continuous training program within the IT industry
* The opportunity to train and mentor others
* Diverse and inclusive culture with a family-like environment The Perks
* Unlimited earning potential – competitive base salary + uncapped commission
* Annual all-inclusive company incentive trips
* Charitable and social responsibility opportunities
* Health and well-being support

title: Systemutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Högskole/universitetsutbildning 120p/180hp inom IT eller


 elektroteknik, eller motsvarande utbildning /arbetslivserfarenhet
   

  

* Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling med ASP.NET
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling med .Net Core
* Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling mot MS-SQL databaser
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling med HTML, CSS och JavaScript
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling med Entity Framework Core
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att utveckla REST API:er
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av frontendutveckling varav minst 3 år med React


**Meriterande**
* Minst två års erfarenhet av arbete med IT-arkitektur och design av mjukvarusystem
* Deltagit i minst två projekt där CI/CD Pipelines har implementerats i Azure DevOps


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 01-12-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Profile/Role:** 
 Data Engineer, AIAD (Senior- Expert)
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm (Sweden or nearshore)
 



  





**Job description:** 









**Responsibilities:** 



* Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
* Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
* Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
* Work close to the Product Owner and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
* Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
* Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
* Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies








**Qualifications:** 



* Passion for Data, people, and technology
* At least 4+ year’s work experience including hands-on as Data engineer on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Experience in GCP tools – Dataflow and Bigquery
* Experience in Data Build Tool (DBT)
* Experience in different data formats (Avro, Parquet)
* Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
* Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages Python, Java /or Scala.
* Good understanding of different data modelling techniques and trade-off
* Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
* Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
* Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
* Experience in working with data visualization tools
* Fluent in English both written and verbal


- 


**Advantage if you also have:** 









**Business understanding of retail industry** 









**Required cloud certification: NA**

title: Erfaren specialist för utveckling av system inom försvarsindustrin
description:
Välkommen till Knowit Dataunit!
   

  

**Vi är ett innovativt, modernt och jämställt bolag som arbetar tillsammans för att leverera de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder. Hos Knowit får du växa och arbeta tillsammans med kunniga kollegor samtidigt som du är med och gör skillnad i samhället.**
 Vi har hjälpt kunder med lösningar inom försvarssystem i över 30 år och söker nu fler till vårt team. Våra kunder kommer till oss när de är i behov av system som har höga krav på tillgänglighet och som används i krävande miljöer. Vi arbetar i projektteam med strukturerade processer och även i projekt med ett agilt arbetssätt.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och ser gärna att du är en person som drivs av att skapa kundnytta och alltid har kundens bästa i fokus. Ansvarstagande och noggrannhet är ytterligare några av dina ledord. Vi tror att du har stor personlig integritet och ett metodiskt arbetssätt. Du trivs med att arbeta i team, samverka med andra och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap.
   

  

 Att jobba på Knowit:
   

  

 Vad kan vi erbjuda dig? Härliga kollegor, kreativt arbete, intressanta kunder både i Sverige och utomlands, utrymme för att dela med sig av kunskap och möjlighet till personlig utveckling. Vi värdesätter en trygg och öppen kultur och tycker det är viktigt att våra medarbetare har möjlighet att kombinera arbete och fritid.
   

  

* Flexibla arbetstider
* Arbete på distans eller i moderna lokaler centralt i Stockholm
* Friskvård
* Privat vårdförsäkring
* Bra pensionslösning
* Möjlighet att ta del av förmånliga försäkringsprogram


 Vill du bli en av oss?
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling av komplexa IT-system med höga krav på säkerhet och tillgänglighet, gärna tio år eller mer.
* Flera års erfarenhet av strukturerat krav- och designarbete gärna i någon av rollerna projektledare, systemarkitekt, systemutvecklare eller testare.
* Goda kunskaper i att dokumentera på svenska
* På grund av krav kopplade till försvarssekretess krävs svenskt medborgarskap för denna roll.


 Vi värdesätter också att du har:
   

  

* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Programmeringskunskaper i något av språken C#, C++, eller Java
* Erfarenhet från försvarsindustrin eller försvaret


 Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan redan idag. Varmt välkommen!

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Help us redefine what it means to be a financial partner for everyday heroes**
 Sambla Group has already helped over 1 million customers take control of their finances. Today we are entering a new chapter. Our ambition is to move beyond loan brokerage and become a trusted personal finance partner. That means supporting customers across more aspects of their financial lives, building app-first experiences, exploring new ventures, and focusing on lasting relationships rather than one-off transactions.
   

  

 We are looking for an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 who wants to be part of this journey. This role is about enabling teams to build products that matter, fostering technical excellence, and helping engineers grow. You will work closely with Product to align priorities, ensure healthy delivery, and maintain the long-term technical health of systems and teams.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Lead and support a cross-functional engineering team, ensuring clarity, alignment, and focus
* Partner with the Product Manager to prioritize work, plan increments, and balance delivery speed with long-term system health
* Ensure high standards in software design, architecture, developer experience, testing, security, and operational reliability
* Establish and track meaningful engineering and product metrics that drive continuous improvement
* Coach and mentor engineers, support career growth, and foster a culture of learning, ownership, and collaboration
* Promote modern engineering practices including CI/CD, observability, and secure coding
* Collaborate with stakeholders across Security, Architecture, Compliance, Data, and Design to deliver safe and high-quality products in a regulated environment
* Help evolve how we work: ways of working, technical patterns, and team processes


**What We Are Looking For**
* We’re looking for someone with a solid background in software engineering who has also taken on leadership responsibilities, such as serving as an Engineering Manager or Tech Lead
* Solid understanding of modern engineering practices and system architecture
* Experience working in product-oriented teams with iterative development and frequent releases in a highly regulated sector
* Ability to build strong partnerships with Product Managers and cross-functional stakeholders, and raise the bar for ways for working within the team and department
* Comfortable using data and metrics to run experiments, guide decisions and measure outcomes
* Passion for coaching, developing people, and fostering a supportive team environment and a dynamic Engineering Culture in the department
* Experience in our technologies: TypeScript, Node.js, React, Next.js, AWS (including CDK and CloudFormation)
* You lead with clarity, calmness, empathy, and accountability
* Experience or understanding of IT governance frameworks, the agile manifesto, and regulatory standards such as DORA or GDPR is considered a bonus


**Why this role?**
* Lead with impact: guide a team that ships products used by thousands of customers
* Shape how we work: help define engineering practices and quality standards at an important stage in Sambla’s evolution
* Grow and develop people: play a key role in coaching and supporting engineers as they progress in their careers
* Work in partnership: collaborate closely with Product to create clear priorities and predictable, meaningful delivery
* Work with purpose: what you enable helps everyday people improve their financial lives


**What we offer:**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

title: Management Associate - Stockholm
description:
**Be a part of the next big thing**
 Do you thrive on tackling complex challenges? Are you passionate about creating impactful solutions that drive commerce forward? Do you believe in encouraging and elevating those around you?
   

  

**About Us**
 Kustom, formerly known as Klarna Checkout (KCO), is the Nordic market leader in digital checkout solutions. Today, we support over 24,000 merchants across more than 170 countries, providing a streamlined checkout experience. We offer localized solutions in 18 markets, tailored to specific languages, currencies, and payment methods. No matter where businesses operate, we deliver a checkout experience that meets the needs of both merchants and shoppers - driving growth globally. 🌍
   

  

**The role**
 As a Management Associate at Kustom, you’ll work directly with our CEO and leadership team to shape and execute our strategic agenda. You’ll act as a trusted analytical partner, helping us navigate key strategic questions, evaluate new opportunities and build the structures that support long term growth. This role is ideal for someone with early top tier consulting experience who wants to accelerate their impact in a fast growing tech environment.
   

  

**Things you'll be doing**
* Leading and supporting strategic analyses across the company, from market mapping to product and commercial strategy
* Driving work related to growth initiatives, including new business exploration, geographic expansion and scaling opportunities
* Supporting M&A activities such as market scans, target assessments, financial modeling and due diligence
* Developing insights and recommendations that help the CEO and leadership team make high quality and data driven decisions
* Structuring complex problems, creating clarity from ambiguity and translating analysis into actionable strategic direction
* Monitoring internal performance and highlighting key drivers, risks and opportunities
* Contributing to internal strategic communication and building narratives around priorities and long term direction


**Skills and experience you'll need**
* Academic degree in business, engineering or another relevant field
* 1–2+ years of experience from top tier management consulting or a similar strategy focused role
* Strong analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to break down complex questions and synthesize clear insights
* Experience working with strategic growth topics such as market analysis, business case development, financial modeling or due diligence
* Comfort working closely with senior stakeholders in fast moving environments
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* A high degree of self-sufficiency and ownership - you’re able to run with problems independently and take full accountability for outcomes


**We believe you'll thrive in this role if you have**
* A strong interest in strategy, growth and the inner workings of scaling tech companies
* A proactive, structured approach and the ability to create clarity in ambiguous problems
* A collaborative and low-ego mindset suited for a small, high performing team
* The motivation to influence key strategic decisions early in your career
* Ambition to grow into future strategy, operations or business leadership roles
* The ability to operate autonomously, prioritize wisely and follow through with high accountability in everything you take on


**Benefits**
* Robust pension plan with national and occupational components
* Excellent health insurance coverage, including long-term illness protection and salary exchange options
* Annual wellness allowance of 3,000 SEK to invest in your health and fitness
* Extra day off when major holidays (e.g., Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve) fall on weekends
* Continuous learning opportunities and professional development support


**A place to grow**
 At Kustom, you won’t just be another face in the crowd. This is a place where we elevate each other and celebrate success as a team. We believe in our ability to create excellence — and have fun doing it!
   

  

 We know we set high expectations, but we also know that the road to success isn’t a straight line. We support and encourage each other to try, to fail, to try again. Because that’s how we grow, individually and together.
   

  

 Does this sound like the place for you?
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please apply in English. At Kustom, we welcome everyone! We don’t care where you’re from, whom you love, or what kind of food is your favorite. We believe in inclusivity for all.
* Given the above, we treat all candidates the same! That’s why we have this awesome recruitment tool to keep track of all the amazing talents that apply - so please; apply through the system and we’ll make sure to keep you updated along the recruitment process. Please note that we can’t keep track of CVs or similar documents sent via email.
* We value your privacy! When you apply, we'll handle your data with care. Want to know more about how we use your information? Check out our FAQs at the bottom of the jobs page - we've got all the details there for you!

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Software Engineer.
 



  





 In this role, you will join a platform-oriented team working with performance and stability testing within eHealth. You will develop and maintain load-test scripts and take part in executing and analyzing the tests. The work requires close collaboration with functional teams to ensure that the system performs and scales as intended.
 



 You should have experience in software development, preferably with a focus on performance and scalability, and solid skills in JavaScript and Java.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 



* You have experience working with Java.
* You have experience with JavaScript.
* You have full-stack troubleshooting experience.
* You have experience using load-testing tools such as Apache JMeter, Grafana k6, LoadRunner or AspectJ Recording Tool.



  





**Nice to have:** 



* You have experience working with relational databases.
* You have experience in performance and stability testing of large-scale IT systems.
* You have experience using different performance analysis tools.



  





 Interested? Apply now

title: Information Security GRC Analyst
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
 Join our dynamic team at Odevo as a passionate Information Security GRC Analyst and play a pivotal role in fortifying our information security landscape! We are on the lookout for a talented individual who is eager to contribute to Odevo’s success. In this exciting position, you'll have the opportunity to design and lead our supplier due diligence program, craft engaging security awareness training, and orchestrate realistic phishing simulations. You'll also be instrumental in shaping a robust information security governance framework, and supporting the development and upkeep of our disaster recovery (DR) plans. Additionally, you'll ensure our sub-businesses are aligned with our security standards, making a significant impact on our overall compliance. If you're ready to take on a challenge and make a true difference, we want to hear from you
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Supplier Due Diligence Program:
* Develop and implement a risk-based supplier due diligence program.
* Assess supplier security practices and ensure compliance with company standards.
* Security Awareness Training:
* Implement and manage security awareness training programs.
* Create and send phishing simulation emails to test employee awareness.
* Analyze results and produce metrics to identify areas for improvement.
* Information Security Policies:
* Create and manage information security policies to ensure compliance and best practices.
* Disaster Recovery (DR) Plans:
* Support the creation and maintenance of disaster recovery plans.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure DR plans are comprehensive and effective.
* Track Compliance to Security Initiatives:
* Work with IT representatives to monitor compliance with Odevo baselines for security implementations in the cloud and across security tooling.
* Report on compliance to management


**Who You Are**
 You possess strong communication skills, enabling you to effectively engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Your detail-oriented nature and proactive approach to problem-solving and solution design make you adept at working with security GRC challenges, translating them into clear and actionable security insights. You are fluent in English and it is an added bonus if you know additional languages such as Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, German, Swedish or Finnish.
   

  

**Experience**
* 2+ years of proven experience in a similar role.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
* Proven experience in information security assurance, with a focus on supplier due diligence and security awareness training.
* Strong understanding of information security policies and best practices.
* Experience in conducting phishing simulations and analysing results.
* Some understanding of security certifications, frameworks and regulations (e.g ISO27001, NIST Cyber Framework, NIS2, DORA).


**Desired Experience (but Not Required)**
* Technical knowledge of security principles, concepts, and technologies.
* Previous experience in aligning to security certifications and regulations (e.g ISO27001, NIS2, DORA)
* Familiarity with disaster recovery planning and implementation.
* Degree in Risk Management, Information Security or a related field.
* Relevant certifications in Information Security GRC or related fields.


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software
   

  

 #msl

title: Spontanansökan
description:
**Kort om oss**
 Linklaters LLP lämnar juridisk rådgivning till världens ledande företag, sponsorer och finansiella institutioner i de mest komplexa transaktionerna och ärendena. Med 31 kontor i de främsta affärs- och finanscentra, levererar Linklaters en unik service till klienter över hela världen. Läs mer om oss på www.linklaters.com eller lyssna på vår podd här.
   

  

**Vem kan söka?**
 Detta är en annons skapad för dig som antingen är:
   

  

* intresserad av ett extrajobb vid sidan av dina studier, eller
* nyligen eller inom kort avslutar dina juridikstudier eller tingsnotariat och är intresserad av en heltidstjänst som biträdande jurist.


 I de fall där vi inte har en specifik annons ute kan du använda denna annons för att visa ditt intresse för en eventuell anställning hos oss.
   

  

*Eftersom denna annons avser spontanansökningar kommer vi endast att återkoppla till de sökande om ett behov uppstår, och då till dem vars profil stämmer överens med våra krav.*
 Vid frågor, vänligen kontakta Marie Lundqvist, HR Advisor.
   

  

**Technical Skills**
**This list of duties and responsibilities above is not exhaustive. It is intended to describe the general content of, and requirements for, the performance of this job. As such, the role may also include the undertaking of additional tasks as required.**

title: IT Project Manager – Stockholm School of Economics (SSE)
description:
**Are you a curious and versatile Project Manager , with a few years of experience, who thrives in a structured yet flexible environment? Do you enjoy working in a dynamic role, leading multiple types of IT projects end-to-end, collaborating closely with stakeholders, and driving improvements ? Join us at SSE and help shape the future of our IT landscape.** 
**What We Offer**
* A dynamic and varied role with opportunities to lead multiple types of IT projects.
* A stimulating work environment where you will help shape the future of the IT department.
* While the role is on-site at our Stockholm campus, we offer flexibility in planning your workday.
* Newly renovated IT office space.
* The chance to work at a prestigious institution with a global reputation in education and research.
* Joining SSE means becoming part of a collaborative and knowledgeable environment where learning and continuous improvement are part of daily life


**About the Role**
 As part of IT Services (ITS), you will be a key driver and coordinator in ongoing improvements to SSE’s IT environment. You will lead projects through the full lifecycle, working closely with business stakeholders and technical teams. Your role will involve bridging the gap between technicians, developers, and decision-makers, ensuring successful delivery and alignment with business needs.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Lead and manage IT projects from initiation to completion. You will manage a mix of small iterative improvements and larger, long-term initiatives, each requiring a tailored approach and strong stakeholder collaboration
* Act as a central link between technical teams and business stakeholders.
* Proactively identify areas for improvement in service delivery and IT performance.
* Ensure structured project execution using recognized methodologies.


**Your Profile**
 We believe you enjoy working in a role with both structure and variation. You are someone who:
   

  

* Thrives in a setting where you collaborate with many different departments and enjoy translating needs between business and technical teams.
* Is comfortable leading projects of varying size and complexity — from quick improvements to larger, long-term initiatives.
* Builds trust easily and communicates clearly, especially when many stakeholders are involved.
* Likes creating order, clarity and momentum, even when conditions or priorities shift.
* Takes ownership, follows through, and knows when to involve others.
* Is curious about understanding how things work, both technically and operationally, and uses that curiosity to improve processes and outcomes.


**Requirements**
* About 2–6 years of experience as an IT Project Manager.
* Proven ability to structure and lead IT projects end-to-end.
* Broad technical understanding and genuine interest in IT and digital solutions.
* Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, or related field.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Fluent in English (Swedish is considered a plus and significant advantage).


**Meritorious**
* Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
* PMP or PRINCE2 certification.
* Familiarity with tools like Jira or similar.


**Location**
 SSE follows an office-first principle to support collaboration and knowledge sharing. This means you are expected to work on-site at our Stockholm campus for the majority of the week. We welcome applicants who already live and work legally in Sweden, as well as those who are able to relocate and obtain the required work permit.
   

  

**Other**
 This is a permanent position, and a 6 months probationary period applies. We are working with work-related tests, such as personality, language, and problem-solving tests, in our recruitments to, as objectively as possible, map factors that are important in our roles. Interviews and references are included in all our processes. Background checks will be conducted on final candidates.

title: IT arkitekt infrastruktur
description:
Vi söker nu en IT arkitekt infrastruktur till vår IT-avdelning.
   

  

 På IT-avdelningen är vi ca 350 medarbetare och vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag gör att vi behöver bli fler. Som en del av vår IT-avdelning kommer du att jobba i en utvecklande miljö, med fokus på medarbetares engagemang och nya idéer. Vi lägger samtidigt mycket energi på att skapa en inkluderande kultur med fokus på jämställdhet och hållbara medarbetare. Vi tror att olika perspektiv och erfarenheter gör oss bättre!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Rollen innebär huvudsakligen att leda arkitekturarbetet inom IT-infrastrukturenheten.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att ta fram förslag på IT-infrastrukturarkitektur, besluta om IT-infrastrukturarkitektur samt säkerställa att beslutad arkitektur följs.
   

  

 Vår utveckling inom IT-avdelningen sker enligt SAFe-ramverket. Vi är virtuellt organiserade i en tågstruktur enligt SAFe-ramverket och det finns ett infrastrukturtåg.
   

  

 I rollen ingår du även i tågledningen för infrastrukturtåget.
   

  

 Du kommer därför primärt att jobba inom ett infrastrukturtåg med att analysera, utvärdera, planera och dokumentera olika arkitekturella lösningar för IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

**Din profil**
 För att trivas i rollen som IT arkitekt infrastruktur hos oss är det viktigt att du som person har god analytisk och problemlösande förmåga samt en god samarbetsförmåga. Du behöver kunna ta egna initiativ, ha ett gott omdöme och ha en helhetssyn på verksamheten för att kunna verka i rollen.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och lämplighet för rollen.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Minst gymnasieutbildning
* Mycket goda kunskaper om IT-infrastruktur, server, virtualisering, container, lagring, nätverk
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av att ha jobbat i en motsvarande roll
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Akademisk utbildning inom relevant område
* Erfarenhet av arbete enligt agila metoder som tex SAFe


**Vi erbjuder**
 Ett myndighetsuppdrag som är viktigt på riktigt! En arbetsplats där vi värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi erbjuder flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Som statligt anställd har du även goda anställningsvillkor och ett förmånspaket med friskvård, lediga klämdagar samt goda semester- och pensionsvillkor. Vårt kontor i Stockholm ligger centralt.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att jobba hos oss här.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Anställningen kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

 Placeringsort är Stockholm eller Luleå.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi jobbar kompetensbaserat i hela processen och är måna om en inkluderande, rättvis, objektiv och kandidatvänlig process. Därför ber vi dig att besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor istället för att be om personligt brev.
   

  

 Vi kan komma att använda oss av arbetspsykologiska tester.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontakta rekryterande chef som hjälper dig med din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.
   

  

 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till annonskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför ytterligare kontakt med media-/annonsförsäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

 Pensionsmyndigheten ansvarar för den allmänna pensionen och informerar om hela pensionen. Varje år betalar vi ut cirka 415 miljarder kronor till 2,3 miljoner pensionärer, genomför cirka 911 000 fondbyten och skickar ut 8 miljoner orange kuvert. Vi har ca 25 miljoner digitala kundkontakter per år. Vi är cirka 1700 medarbetare på åtta orter, från Luleå i norr till Halmstad i söder.
   

  

 Vi gör pensionen enklare.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2025-184 | Kontakt: Per Schölin 46104542258, | Facklig företrädare: Anna-Karin Åhrman Cortelius, Saco-s 010-4543914, Michael Karlsson, ST 010-4543427, | Publicerat: 2025-11-24 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-14

title: BIT - Head of Integrations
description:
**Who We Are**
 We’re bold thinkers and kind teammates, growing fast but staying grounded. Our Nordic roots and global outlook shape a culture of friendliness, creativity, and collaboration, all powered by openness and shared wins. We care deeply about doing the right thing - and doing it together. We aim to improve the flow of goods, time, and energy - and we know we can’t shape the future by clinging to the past. So, we keep evolving together.
   

  

**What We Do**
 RELEX Solutions delivers a unified supply chain planning platform for retailers and manufacturers, enabled by proven AI technology. We help companies optimize demand forecasting, replenishment, merchandising, pricing and promotions, supply chain operations, and production planning across the end-to-end value chain.
   

  

 With a global team of over 2,000 professionals, we work side-by-side with our customers to solve real problems with lasting impact. Companies trust RELEX to increase product availability, boost sales, deliver actionable insights, improve sustainability, and drive profitable growth. Join us and make an impact on the world and your career!
   

  

 In response to our fast growth and market expansion, we are looking for a
 **Head of Integrations** 
 that will lead and oversee the internal integration strategy and execution across our organization. This role involves managing a team to ensure seamless integration of systems, applications, and technologies that enhance operational efficiency and support business objectives.
   

  

**What We Need You To Do And Be**
 Bring your ideas. Challenge ours. Grow with us.
   

  

 You’ll play a key role in designing, implementing, and optimizing integration solutions across departments and platforms.
   

  

**Main responsibilities:**
* Develop and execute a comprehensive internal integration strategy aligned with business goals.
* Provide visionary leadership to the integration team, fostering innovation and efficiency.
* Lead, mentor, and develop a team of integration specialists and developers, building a collaborative and results-driven culture.
* Oversee the design and implementation of integrations between internal and external systems, ensuring data consistency and reliability.
* Stay curious about emerging technologies and industry best practices. Evaluate and recommend tools and solutions to enhance integration capabilities.
* Partner with IT, software development, and business stakeholders to understand integration needs. Work closely with vendors and third-party providers to ensure seamless delivery.
* Identify and mitigate integration risks, ensuring data security, compliance, and resilience.
* Maintain clear, comprehensive documentation of integration processes, configurations, and troubleshooting guides.


**What You’ll Bring To The Table**
 Our five values are our playbook. We speak up when things don’t make sense. We stop doing what doesn’t add value. We stay curious, back each other up, and make space for both innovation and laughter.
   

  

* Solid experience leading integration strategy and architecture in complex enterprise environments.
* Deep expertise in Azure Integration Services and a strong grasp of API design, event-driven architectures, and real-time data flows.
* Proven ability to lead and grow technical teams, driving collaboration and continuous improvement.
* Clear communicator who bridges business and technical perspectives with ease.
* Strategic thinker with a proactive, problem-solving mindset.
* Resilient and adaptable, thriving in a growing environment where processes are still taking shape.
* Curious about emerging technologies and how they can make integrations smarter and more efficient.
* Comfortable with using AI in your everyday work and developing the use of AI tools as a larger organizational strategy.
* Fluent in written and spoken English.


**What We See As An Advantage**
* Experience integrating Workday, Salesforce, NetSuite, or other large-scale enterprise systems.
* Azure certifications or equivalent experience with cloud integration platforms.
* Familiarity with data governance, security best practices, and cloud networking.
* Experience of working with an international team


**What We Offer In Return**
 You’ll be supported and given the space to thrive. We offer meaningful work, flexibility, and a culture that backs you to share your voice and be authentic.
   

  

* An international career and learning opportunities
* A rapidly growing and financially robust software company with exciting opportunities for career growth, also in the future


 These are the RELEX key benefits
   

  

* Flexible working
* Genuine work-life balance
* Annual leave
* Internet and mobile phone benefits
* Diverse, inclusive, and supportive work culture
* Meaningful work with a commitment to a more sustainable future
* High autonomy
* Room for creativity
* Strong team spirit through company parties, two team days per year, and after-work activities
* Family-oriented policies
* Flat hierarchies
* Two paid volunteering days each year


 We are a global community of different cultures, voices, and experiences. We celebrate what makes us unique and connect through what we share, in an authentic and safe environment. Together we shape the future, and each other.
   

  

 If you feel this is the opportunity you don’t want to miss, you can apply by sending your cover letter and resume through the application form as soon as possible.
   

  

*Please note that to be considered for this position, candidates must be based in Finland or Sweden and hold a valid work permit. We’re excited to connect with applicants who meet these criteria and share our passion for shaping the future together.*
**Apply today and be part of the future. Be RELEX!**

title: Junior Project Manager (m/f/d) based in Stockholm, Sweden
description:
**Who we are** 




  





 rpc – The Retail Performance Company is the consulting firm for the entire journey toward a customer-oriented transformation: from customer-centric strategy and customer experience design to data analytics, people empowerment, and performance management. Our mission is to support our clients with holistic end-to-end solutions - from strategy to implementation - all from a single source. Our focus is on creating inspiring customer experiences that enable sustainable, value-driving relationships between brands and end customers.
 



  





 rpc was founded in 2013 as a joint venture between the BMW Group and H&Z Unternehmensberatung AG and now has over 450 employees across twelve countries.
 



  





**Your Tasks** 




  





 We’re looking for a
 **Junior** 
**Project Manager (m/f/d)** 
 to support a major transformation initiative within a
 **premium automotive client’s retail network** 
 . This role coordinates a structured rollout and requires someone who is highly organized, proactive, and comfortable steering multiple workstreams in a dynamic project environment.
 



  





 The
 **preferred starting date is January 2026** 
 , the position is
 **limited to one year with the possibility of extension** 
 , and the assignment will be
 **based in Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
 



 Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:
 



  




* Supporting the Project Manager with operational PMO tasks and stakeholder alignment.
* Coordinating and maintaining the
 **rollout plan** 
 for a large-scale retail transformation project in
 *Jira* 
 and
 *Confluence* 
 .
* Tracking progress across workstreams, updating timelines, and following up on deliverables.
* Organizing and structuring activities across several stakeholder groups to ensure smooth project execution.
* Planning, scheduling, and leading
 **project-related meetings** 
 , including documentation and follow-up.
* Organizing
 **events and information sessions** 
 for the client's retail network and internal staff.
* Coordinating
 **training activities** 
 and acting as a point of contact for the the client's retail network.
* Handling administrational project tasks and responding to questions around internal processes and tools.
* Presenting in a
 **professional and confident manner** 
 in management-level settings.



 You'll join a collaborative team with a mix of experience levels and personalities — an energetic, positive, and dynamic environment that encourages ownership and teamwork.
 



  





**Your Profile** 




  




* First experience in
 **PMO roles** 
 or structured project support.
* Experience working with
 **ticketing or workflow systems** 
 (e.g. project tracking or collaboration platforms) is an advantage.
* Fast learner who can quickly adapt to new processes and tools.
* Strong communication skills and confidence in following up with stakeholders.
* Professional appearance and comfortable engaging in management-level discussions.
* Strong organizational talent with the ability to bring structure into dynamic, fast-moving workstreams.
* Proactive, dependable, solution-oriented mindset.
* **Fluent in English** 
 ; any Nordic language is a plus, but
 **no Swedish is required** 
 .



  





**What our employees value** 




  





**Consulting 2.0** 




 A consulting environment that is reinventing itself: With us, your project workload does
 *not* 
 affect your bonus, and we offer you maximum flexibility — for example through sabbaticals, remote work, and part-time options — to suit your individual life situation. We ensure your well-being through a mentoring program, regular happiness checks, and a certified feel-good manager.
 



  





**rpc Spirit** 




 A company culture that’s simply better than the others — it’s just true! Our employees describe us as open, dynamic, friendly, and appreciative. We follow a strict “No Jerks” policy. Decision paths are short, and hierarchies are flat. You can experience the latter best at one of our legendary company events.
 



  





**Questions?** 




 Then give us a call or send us a message:
 



**Sabine Schroth** 




 Co-Head of Human Resources
 



 career@rpc-partners.com
 



 +49 (0) 89 2000 5080
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Senior IT Architect - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Stockholm office, we are looking for Senior IT Architects to help our clients on national and international projects! (Senior) IT Architects are part of our consulting teams who focus for instance on tech-oriented analyses, review & specification of IT systems or architectures, technical solution design, process improvement and target architecture definitions. Together with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group, you will develop superior IT strategies, concepts, and solutions actively and on site, applying your technical know-how combined with your analytical and conceptual skillset. Based on your IT project experience, you are able to provide content guidance to and coordinate smaller teams.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* completed a university degree in computer science, informatics, engineering, or a related discipline with higher-than-average grades
* bring a minimum of four years relevant experience in IT consulting, management of IT projects, or professional software development
* have led project teams of more than three people
* know that modern tools, such as machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile methods, AI, and robotics aren't just buzzwords - but essential to sustainable IT architectures
* are familiar with popular software development methods and tools
* feel particularly comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts - while traveling to our clients in- and outside of your home country
* are on a fluent level of understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* You will form the digital transformation of globally leading companies, ensuring their success by evaluating our clients' digital capabilities and performing feasibility studies
* You will manage small, agile development teams in strategic IT implementation programs, establish modern practices like DevOps and CI/CD, and be responsible for the technical implementation of crucial digital requirements, such as cyber resilience
* You will analyze, develop, and optimize cutting-edge, customized IT architectures while leading small teams and applying your comprehensive understanding of legacy IT, enterprise solutions, and current market developments and trends such as cloud computing and microservices


 Additional info
   

  

**How To Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we cultivate a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Webcast Manager
description:
**Webcast Manager** 




  





**LOCATION: Stockholm, Sweden** 




**HYBRID MODEL: 3 days a week in the office** 




  





**This is a 12-month Fixed Term Contract**




  





 Do you love bringing events to life, both online and in person? Are you a natural multitasker who thrives in a fast-paced environment? We’re looking for a
 **Webcast Manager** 
 to plan, manage, and execute virtual and on-site Investor Relations events, from webcasts to live productions. In this role, you’ll juggle project timelines, coordinate with teams, communicate with corporate clients, and make sure every event runs smoothly. If you have a background in video production, project management, and digital media (plus fluency in Swedish and English), we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**Day to day responsibilities of the role include, but are not limited to:** 



* Develop and maintain full-scale, detailed project plans to be used in tracking key project milestones and deliverables weekly. Identify critical paths and dependencies with other departments, resources or 3rd party contractors.
* Perform webcast configuration, testing and delivery. Including coordinating live day execution across resources to ensure a successful event.
* Organize, prepare and upload event content (text, images, audio, video, etc.)
* Assist in the live production of webcasts, recordings and broadcastings.
* Ensure the quality of the event is up to the client’s standards and provides frontline support across multiple events, ensuring issues are resolved in a timely matter and to the clients' satisfaction.
* Establish an excellent working relationship with assigned clients and continuously strive to improve the level of overall service the company provides.
* Handle immediate project escalations and advise next steps to ensure proper resolution.
* Build a strong relationship with clients and proactively be source of recommendations
* Work with management on developing and maintaining client project records, helping to strategize to meet client goals over time.
* Partner with streaming colleagues and management to improve processes and improve client experience.



  





**What you should bring:** 



* Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university. Equivalent work experience in a similar position may be substituted for educational requirements.
* 1+ years of experience in digital media, webcasting, video production or content production, or multimedia web design required.
* 1+ years of project coordination experience is desirable.
* Ability to coordinate multiple projects at various stages of the lifecycle.
* Ability to keep up to date on virtual event technology.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Must be fluent in Swedish and English.
* Strong organization skills and the ability to multi-task.
* Ability to be innovative and think outside of the box.
* Ability to handle frequent changes.
* Comfortable interacting with clients at all levels of an organization.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite required.
* Knowledge of Adobe Suite of Applications (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere) required.
* Video encoding and editing are desirable.
* Knowledge/Experience of Live Streaming / On-Demand Streaming desirable.
* Knowledge of Networking (Firewalls, Proxy, etc.) is desirable.



  





**Why Notified…** 




 We place a lot of value in giving our clients the solutions and support they need to operate efficiently and successfully. This same desire we use to set our customers up for success applies to our employees as well. Notified committed to helping our employees and their families maintain a healthy work/life balance, to build a financially secure future. Self-development and learning are key with all our global employees having access to our internal learning and development university DevelopU for career and skills enhancement.
 



  





**What do we offer:** 



* Global collaboration with team members in 17 countries
* Opportunities to innovate and grow!
* Comprehensive health benefits and wellness programs
* Quarterly recognition awards
* Curated learning libraries offering over 8,000 free courses supporting your business and technical acumen
* Flexibility to work from home on Mondays and Fridays
* Diversity is celebrated and supported inclusive Employee Resource Groups



  





**About NOTIFIED!** 




 At Notified, we help the world’s top brands tell their stories and connect with the audiences that matter most. Whether it’s sharing company news, engaging with the media, or keeping investors informed, our powerful communications platform makes it all easy and impactful.
 



 We bring together public relations and investor relations tools in one smart, intuitive solution - backed by cutting-edge technology and a team that genuinely cares.
 



 Every day, we empower thousands of organizations to build trust, drive awareness, and shape their reputation. If you believe in the power of storytelling and meaningful communication, apply today and start your story with Notified!
 



  





**Award-Winning Technology & Service** 



* #1 Press Release Distribution,
 *Summer 2025 G2 Report*
* PR Innovation of the Year,
 *2025 Gold Stevie Awards Winner*
* Platinum Winner,
 *2025 Titan Business Awards*
* 2025 PRWeek Awards Finalist
* Inc. 2024 Best in Business List
* Best Press Release Distribution Company,
 *MarTech Breakthrough Awards*



  





**What’s next…** 




 Qualified candidates will be contacted by a member of our in-house recruitment team to kick-start the recruitment process. If you are a possible fit, you will be invited to meet with a few key individuals in order to help you get a full understanding of the team and the position. Our goal is for you to get to know us as we get to know you!
 



  





*At Notified we don't just accept difference - we celebrate it, support it, and build success upon it. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer, and no part of this advertisement is intended to discriminate on any grounds.* 




  





**Apply now to join our successful team!** 




  





*Please note:* 




 Subject to local legislation, and as applicable to the position to which you have applied, Notified may require your consent at the point of offer to complete certain background screening checks including (but not limited to) Legal right to work in the relevant country, reference checks, Credit checks and Criminal checks. Failure to complete these checks / meet the required criteria may result in offer withdrawal.

title: Software Engineer – Application Specialist
description:
We are seeking a talented Software Engineer/Application Specialist to improve and maintain our Financial Risk services.
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Join the exciting journey of our Financial Risk Value Stream that is responsible for strategic development and maintenance of Swedbank´s Financial Risk solutions.
* Build strong technical competence and take a key part of improving, refining, and maintaining our tools and systems, to continuously comply with internal needs and regulatory requirements.
* Be involved in vendor communication, planning, development, configuration, documentation and verification processes.
* Follow Swedbank´s IT process management guidelines and make our services the best in class.
* Gain knowledge about our business area within Financial Risk including Market Risk, Counterparty Credit Risk and Asset & Liability Management (ALM) Risk solutions.
* Collaborate with software engineers, analysts, risk officers, architects and product owners for successful system improvements.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Good problem-solving skills with a structured way of working and eager to learn.
* Easy-going, open-minded and good team player.
* Excellent knowledge of Linux/Unix system administration.
* Experience in Shell scripting is required.
* Experience in using Python, SQL and other scripting languages is an advantage.
* Knowledge of database structures is an advantage.
* Good understanding of ITIL.
* University degree in Computer science, Engineering or equivalent.
* Proficient in oral and written English with excellent communication skills.
* Experience in working with financial/risk systems is a significant advantage.
* Experience from Agile way of working specifically with SaFe framework is a plus.
* Willingness to support users and provide technical assistance.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

* get a challenging role in an international team of professionals with a mix of risk management and IT experts, who are jointly delivering challenging projects as well as maintaining advanced IT systems. I expect ambition, proficiency and self-leadership from the team members, in an equal and healthy work environment. We are always open to new ideas and innovations helping us to improve and have fun at work.” Ilias Metaxas, your future manager


 We look forward to receiving your application by 31.12.2025.
   

  

**Location:
 **Stockholm, Sundbyberg****
**Recruiting manager:
 **Ilias Metaxas****
 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Arkitekt
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av applikationsutveckling med Java-teknik (JavaEE eller motsvarande)
* Har bred och aktiv kunskap från de senaste 4 åren gällande applikationsarkitektur
* Har 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av integrationer samt integrationsmönster de senaste 5 åren.
* Har 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av händelsedriven arkitektur de senaste 5 åren.
* Har 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling med stort säkerhetsfokus de senaste 5 åren.
* Har arbetslivserfarenhet av större myndigheter med komplexa miljöer.
* Har bred och aktiv kunskap om strategisk arkitekturstyrning
* Har bred arbetslivserfarenhet av beredning och kravhantering
* Har självständigt drivit och genomfört modelleringar/utredningar/förstudier
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom Data/IT, eller motsvarande kompetens som bedöms likvärdig


**Meriterande**
* Kunskap/Arbetslivserfarenhet med Containerbaserade plattformar, t.ex. Kubernetes, OpenShift, Docker etc.
* Kunskap/Arbetslivserfarenhet inom arkitekturramverk så som Togaf, Geaf, Zachman framwork
* Kunskap/Arbetslivserfarenhet inom modelleringsverktyget EA Sparx


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 28-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**Primary Duties & Responsibilities**
* Daily management of outsourced production.
* Build-up and introduction of new products made at contract manufacturing sites.
* Monitor yield and costs; initiate corrective actions on yield losses and related problems.
* Track and execute improvement actions.
* Monitor quality and execute out-of-control actions.
* Support NPI (New Product Introduction) processes as new products enter production lines.
* Conduct data analysis in JMP.
* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure effective execution of projects.


**Education & Experience**
* Master’s degree in Engineering or Science or equivalent.
* Solid competence in program or project management.
* Experience in the electro-optical industry is beneficial.


**Skills**
* Demonstrated initiative and practical leadership skills.
* Strong communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with internal manufacturing staff, R&D, Commodity Managers, finance, global Coherent manufacturing sites, and contract manufacturers.
* Language: Fluent English; Fluent Swedish is preferred.


**Safety Requirements**
