title: SMB Engagement Manager - EMEA
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The role**
 The way legal work gets done is changing - and Customer Success is at the heart of that transformation. We’re looking for an experienced, thoughtful SMB Customer Success Manager with a demonstrated operational record to join our growing team in Stockholm and help drive how the world’s top law firms adopt, scale, and succeed with Legora.
   

  

 This is a hands-on role for someone who knows how to build deep client relationships, deliver real value fast, and act as a trusted advisor throughout the customer journey, while being comfortable owning/leading commercial conversations. You’ll work closely with new and existing clients to ensure they are onboarded smoothly, supported effectively, and continually discovering new ways to unlock value with next generation AI and our platform.
   

  

 You’ll also be a founding pillar in a critical function, helping shape how we scale Customer Success for the SMB segment at Legora from the ground up.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 You’ll be the face of Legora for our clients post-sale - guiding them from onboarding through adoption, expansion, and renewal. Specifically, you will:
   

  

* Own and manage a portfolio of SMB clients post-sale, acting as their main point of contact and trusted advisor
* Lead client onboarding and implementation, ensuring a seamless and successful launch experience
* Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with clients across various roles and functions
* Deliver structured, scalable engagement plans that promote product adoption and deliver measurable value
* Guide clients through best practices and usage strategies that align with their goals and workflows
* Identify and support renewal and upsell opportunities by understanding client needs and highlighting relevant solutions
* Monitor client health and engagement metrics using internal tools — proactively managing risks and surfacing insights
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Marketing to represent client needs and improve the overall experience
* Help shape and refine our SMB Engagement playbook and client-facing processes as we grow across EMEA


**Who You Are**
 You care deeply about customer outcomes - and you know that successful adoption doesn’t just happen. You’re proactive, strategic, and deeply comfortable working with demanding clients. You take pride in being the reason customers stay, grow, and succeed.
   

  

**We’re Looking For**
* 3–5 years of experience in client-facing roles such as engagement, customer success, or account management
* Proven experience working directly with clients, managing relationships, and driving outcomes in B2B settings
* Background in one or more of the following: SaaS, AI platforms, startups, or the legal sector
* Demonstrated ability to drive product adoption, retain clients, and support account growth
* Strong commercial instincts with comfort in identifying upsell opportunities and leading renewal conversations
* Excellent communication skills — fluent in English (additional European languages are a plus)
* Strong organizational and project management capabilities; able to manage multiple client relationships in parallel
* A collaborative mindset with the ability to work cross-functionally and represent the voice of the client
* A builder’s mentality — excited to contribute to the design of our engagement processes and tools
* This is a Stockholm-based, 5-day in-office role — we believe building together in person drives better outcomes


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Senior Manager - Data Management and Enterprise Architecture Expert within Management Consulting
description:
**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly performing and experienced Senior Data Management and Enterprise Architecture Professional to join our team within Management Consulting. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data management, data governance, and data analytics as well as working with Business and IT Architecture, with a proven track record of delivering successful projects. This will involve working closely with clients to understand and approach their data challenges. This includes developing and implementing data strategies and enterprise architecture design to ensure data quality, compliance and the effective utilization of data for strategy deployment.
   

  

 The role can be placed in Stockholm or Gothenburg, depending on your location and preference.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Lead and manage projects in the data management and enterprise architecture area, ensuring timely and successful delivery
* Develop and implement data governance frameworks and policies to ensure data quality, integrity, compliance and security
* Drive and lead initiatives within the enterprise architecture domain, addressing strategic questions related to application landscapes, system integration, data flows, platform selection, and alignment with business capabilities
* Collaborate with clients to understand their data requirements and provide tailored data solutions
* Design and implement data architectures and data models to support business objectives
* Actively drive the collaboration with sectors/accounts and KPMG global capabilities to identify opportunities and drive business development
* Mentor and guide junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data management and analytics


 ,
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field
* Minimum of 12 years of experience in data management and enterprise architecture or related fields
* Strong knowledge of data governance frameworks, data quality management, and data protection regulation
* Experience working with modern data platforms such as Databricks, Snowflake, Microsoft Azure Data Platform, or other relevant technologies
* Hands-on experience with data migration, integration, and building scalable data pipelines across modern cloud or on-premise environments
* Experience with AI and machine learning technologies
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with clients and team members
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects and deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines


**Why Join KPMG**
**Global Network:** 
 Be part of a global network of professionals and gain access to international projects and knowledge sharing
   

  

**Career Development:** 
 Benefit from continuous learning and development opportunities, including training courses, mentorship programs, and career progression pathways
   

  

**Inclusive Culture:** 
 Work in an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone's ideas and contributions are valued
   

  

**Impactful Work:** 
 Make a lasting, positive impact on clients and society through meaningful and challenging work
   

  

 At KPMG, we are committed to fostering a culture of integrity, excellence, and collaboration. We believe in empowering our people to make a positive impact on our clients, communities, and society. Our values guide our actions and help us achieve our vision of being the preferred insights-led professional services firm.
   

  

 If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for digital transformation and a commitment to excellence, we invite you to join our team at KPMG and help us shape the future of our clients' businesses.
   

  

**Make a difference with us?**
 We welcome and look forward to receiving your application also during the summer, the selection process will begin at the start of August.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please contact Marie-Louise Bååth, marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se

title: Tech Lead – Frontend
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling i JavaScript/TypeScript eller liknande
* Har arbetat med React och React Native
* Har erfarenhet av microservices och molnplattform (gärna Google Cloud)
* Är van vid CI/CD, terraform, API-integrationer och eventdriven arkitektur
* Har god förståelse för hur man bygger och skalar produkter
* Kommunicerar väl på svenska och engelska


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 01-12-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Information Security GRC Analyst
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
 Join our dynamic team at Odevo as a passionate Information Security GRC Analyst and play a pivotal role in fortifying our information security landscape! We are on the lookout for a talented individual who is eager to contribute to Odevo’s success. In this exciting position, you'll have the opportunity to design and lead our supplier due diligence program, craft engaging security awareness training, and orchestrate realistic phishing simulations. You'll also be instrumental in shaping a robust information security governance framework, and supporting the development and upkeep of our disaster recovery (DR) plans. Additionally, you'll ensure our sub-businesses are aligned with our security standards, making a significant impact on our overall compliance. If you're ready to take on a challenge and make a true difference, we want to hear from you
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Supplier Due Diligence Program:
* Develop and implement a risk-based supplier due diligence program.
* Assess supplier security practices and ensure compliance with company standards.
* Security Awareness Training:
* Implement and manage security awareness training programs.
* Create and send phishing simulation emails to test employee awareness.
* Analyze results and produce metrics to identify areas for improvement.
* Information Security Policies:
* Create and manage information security policies to ensure compliance and best practices.
* Disaster Recovery (DR) Plans:
* Support the creation and maintenance of disaster recovery plans.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure DR plans are comprehensive and effective.
* Track Compliance to Security Initiatives:
* Work with IT representatives to monitor compliance with Odevo baselines for security implementations in the cloud and across security tooling.
* Report on compliance to management


**Who You Are**
 You possess strong communication skills, enabling you to effectively engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Your detail-oriented nature and proactive approach to problem-solving and solution design make you adept at working with security GRC challenges, translating them into clear and actionable security insights. You are fluent in English and it is an added bonus if you know additional languages such as Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, German, Swedish or Finnish.
   

  

**Experience**
* 2+ years of proven experience in a similar role.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
* Proven experience in information security assurance, with a focus on supplier due diligence and security awareness training.
* Strong understanding of information security policies and best practices.
* Experience in conducting phishing simulations and analysing results.
* Some understanding of security certifications, frameworks and regulations (e.g ISO27001, NIST Cyber Framework, NIS2, DORA).


**Desired Experience (but Not Required)**
* Technical knowledge of security principles, concepts, and technologies.
* Previous experience in aligning to security certifications and regulations (e.g ISO27001, NIS2, DORA)
* Familiarity with disaster recovery planning and implementation.
* Degree in Risk Management, Information Security or a related field.
* Relevant certifications in Information Security GRC or related fields.


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software

title: Senior Director, CIO Analyst and Thought Leader for National Defense; EMEA Remote
description:
**Description**
 Gartner is recruiting for a Senior Director Analyst to join its Government and Education Practice, supporting defense CIOs and technology executives in advancing modernization and innovation. This role delivers actionable insights on emerging technologies, data integration, and operational resilience, engaging with European and global defense organizations. The ideal candidate has 12+ years of EMEA or NATO defense IT leadership, deep expertise across military domains, and strong analytical, communication, and mentoring skills, enabling clients to navigate complex challenges and drive mission-critical priorities in a rapidly evolving geopolitical landscape.
   

  

 About This Role:
   

  

 Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market insights and best practices for a broad range of defense organizations. This analyst role sits within Gartner’s CIO and AI Leaders Research, Government and Education Practice. The analyst will support CIOs and other technology executives in accelerating national defense modernization and innovation.
   

  

 A Senior Director serves as a leader within Gartner’s Business and Technology Insights organization, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional, and/or global levels. Using exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing insights that Gartner clients consume and apply to their mission-critical priorities.. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner’s value every day. They engage with defense clients through the creation of content and via in-person and virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.
   

  

 The person filling this role will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of defense organizations and their partners by guiding them in their use of emerging technologies and data to drive operational resilience, enable seamless multi-domain integration and interoperability and strengthen workforce readiness as they navigate the complexities of today’s geopolitical landscape.
   

  

 What You Will Do
   

  

* Track European and global defense market trends, relevant vendors, emerging technologies, and best practices to advise CIOs and IT Executives in staying ahead in a constantly evolving technology landscape and changing geopolitical uncertainties
* Build credibility as a defense technology and data expert for CIOs and IT Executives expert representing Gartner Business and Technology Insights
* Actively participate in ideation and research community discussions to establish strong positions on topics that impact Government CIOs and develop research
* Lead qualitative and quantitative studies to establish thought-provoking insights for our C-level clients
* Write evidence-based content that is easily consumed, defensible and actionable.
* Deliver high-quality, actionable advice to an executive client audience (e.g., CIOs, program executive officers, CTOs, etc.) through a variety of media.
* Create and deliver thought-provoking presentations for webinars, executive briefings and other client-facing events.
* Deliver outstanding sales and service support to retain and grow the Gartner business..
* Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and the Business and Technology Insights group excel in delivering client value
* Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members


 What You’ll Need
   

  

* 12+ years of relevant IT and/or program executive leadership working for an EMEA or NATO defense organization and with its ecosystem of allies, partners, IT vendors and contractors
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience; Graduate degree preferred
* An informed understanding of the strategic and operational challenges facing defense leaders within and across military domains (i.e., land, sea, air, space, cyber)
* Extensive experience in European defense leading strategy and/or implementation of programs and technical capabilities in one or more of the following areas:
* AI strategy, solutions and/or implementation, including data readiness
* Data integration and visualization for the purpose of establishing a common operating picture in defense
* Cybersecurity and resilience trends and program requirements
* IT infrastructure and operations, including cloud services and edge computing
* Quantum computing trends
* Autonomous systems
* Multi-domain command and control systems
* Communication and information systems
* Demonstrate executive presence; can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders
* Learning agility and adeptness with navigating highly matrixed environments
* Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment.
* Strong organizational skills: with the ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high-quality deliverables
* Strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
* Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills; ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions.
* Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data; can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.
* Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team


 Preferred Education and Experience:
   

  

* Master's degree or equivalent degree preferred
* Prior experience in a product leader or a consulting role for a technology service


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective business and technology insights, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our vast, virtually untapped market potential offers limitless opportunities – opportunities that may not even exist right now – for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:101153
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy

title: Identity and Access Management (IAM) Lead
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
 Are you ready to take the helm in shaping the future of identity and access management at Odevo? We are on the lookout for a passionate and technically adept IAM Technical Lead who is eager to dive into both strategic leadership and hands-on implementation. This is not just a role; it's an opportunity to make a significant impact on the security and efficiency of our access management systems.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Lead with Vision: Drive a comprehensive review of our existing IAM processes and tools, setting a strategic direction that aligns with Odevo's ambitious goals.
* Hands-On Implementation: Roll up your sleeves and get involved in the technical nitty-gritty. You'll be implementing cutting-edge IAM solutions that enhance our security posture.
* Innovate and Optimize: Identify gaps in our current IAM framework and propose innovative solutions that streamline processes and bolster security.
* Collaborate and Influence: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of IAM strategies across the organization.
* Mentor and Inspire: Guide and support Tech staff in all things IAM and improve their understanding of IAM tools and processes.


**What We’re Looking For**
* A seasoned IAM expert with a strong technical background and a proven track record in implementation.
* A strategic thinker who can see the big picture but also has an eye for detail.
* A proactive problem-solver who thrives in a dynamic environment and is always looking for ways to improve and innovate.
* Experience with migrating existing IAM solutions.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.
* Have a thirst for knowledge, keeping up to date with the constantly changing security and IAM landscape
* Good understanding of security certifications, frameworks and regulations (e.g ISO27001, NIST Cyber Framework, NIS2, DORA).


 You are fluent in English and it is an added bonus if you know additional languages such as Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, German, Swedish or Finnish.
   

  

 Join us at Odevo and be at the forefront of transforming our IAM landscape. If you're ready to lead, innovate, and make a real difference, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Be Odevo’s IAM Expert:**
* Be the first point of all for things “IAM”
* Provide guidance and direction on IAM for new projects


**Inventory And Assessment**
* Conduct a thorough inventory of existing IAM processes, tools, and coverage.
* Evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of current IAM systems.
* Identify current gaps in IAM processes and tooling.
* Develop actionable plans to address and rectify identified gaps.


**Strategic Planning**
* Distinguish between strategic and tactical initiatives.
* Propose a balanced approach that includes long-term strategies and quick wins.


**Privileged Access Management (PAM) Review**
* Assess current PAM practices and identify requirements for improvement.
* Review admin usage (such as local, system & enterprise admins) and propose strategies to minimize risks.
* Recommend best practices for PAM implementation and management.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience in Identity Access Management, with a focus on strategic planning and implementation.
* Proven experience with Entra ID as primary SSO solution. Having Microsoft SC-300 certification is a bonus.
* Strong understanding of IAM processes, tools, and best practices.
* Experience with Privileged Access Management (PAM), including local admin usage, and password safe solutions.
* Familiarity with Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) technologies and strategies.
* Ability to conduct gap analysis and develop strategic plans.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Relevant certifications in IAM or related fields are a plus.


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo

title: Sales Engineer- Nordics
description:
**Sales Engineer - Nordics**
 Radware is a global leader in cyber security and application delivery solutions for physical, cloud, and software-defined data centers.
   

  

 At Radware, we live and breathe cybersecurity. It is our passion. Each day, our international team works to earn the trust of more than thousands of organizations around the globe. Keeping them safe is our mission. To that end, we go head-to-head with politically motivated hacktivists, dangerous nation-state threat actors and other notorious cyber attackers — these are not your average adversaries. Backed by nearly 30 years of experience, Radware is best known for its technical excellence and innovative network and application security solutions. That is why it is so important that we build our team with bold and bright talent.
   

  

 At Radware, we fight for the good guys to protect customers from the increasing sophistication, volume, and severity of cyber security breaches. In any increasingly challenging threat landscape, customers need specialist skills to protect their digital assets and We provide innovative technology and Cloud Services to guarantee the continuity and security of the online digital experience.
   

  

****What is the job:****
**We are looking for a highly motivated Sales Engineer with Security and Cloud backgrounds.**
 As a Sales Engineer at Radware, you’ll need to be capable of leading technical sales activities and managing the customer technical relationship. You must possess the highest levels of both business and technical acumen, defining and architecting solutions that meet the business and technical requirements and striving to provide the right solution to our customers and prospects based on their technical expertise.
   

  

* Being part of the regional sales team and working hand in hand with the Sales Account Managers to formulate an account strategy using proven sales tools and sales methodology.
* Driving revenue and creating sales opportunities by managing the pre-sales technical process and evangelizing Radware technology to existing and prospective customers.
* Design solutions for customer's business requirements from the Radware product and service portfolio.
* Partnering with direct sales and executive sponsors to educate existing and prospective customers and partners about the superiority of Radware products and services. This includes conference calls, online meetings, site visits, presentations, technical evaluations, technical objection handling, proposals, and follow-up on all customer-related questions.
* Engaging and overseeing the development of customer proposals, including design and delivery, and providing a consultative approach based on Industry-wide and Radware expertise.
* Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, and other internal teams to ensure that customers get appropriate updates, upgrades and event-oriented information and solutions.
* Respond to Request for Information (RFI), Request for Proposals (RFPs), and Request for Quotes (RFQs) by providing fully documented, detailed solutions with the required technical information.
* Manage Demos and Proof of Concept (POCs).
* Compliance with pre-sales processes, including account activity tracking to drive business analysis and reporting.


****What you need:****
* 5+ years of experience in Network and Application Security, Pre-sales Engineering, or real-world use of database and/or Web application solutions (preferably with 3+ of these years as a Sales Engineer) for a security vendor or Reseller.
* Possess a solid understanding of networking and security equipment and architectures On-Premises or cloud-based, knowledge of Web applications, databases, security, and auditing environments.
* Solid knowledge of Routing, Switching, TCP/IP, HTTP, Load Balancing/Application Delivery Controllers, Reverse Proxies, Caching, CDN, Compression, (NG) Firewalls, Network & Application DDoS.
* Good knowledge of Application Security especially Api Security and Bot Management.
* Vendor and product knowledge of Akamai CDN, DDoS, WAF, Cisco ASA PIX FW, Citrix NetScaler, Checkpoint FW, Corero DDoS, F5 ADC, DDoS, WAF, Fortinet DDoS, FW, Imperva/Incapsula, Palo Alto preferable.
* Knowledge of Public cloud providers like AWS, Azure and GCP.
* High level of English


****How can you stand out:****
* Good presentation, speaking, and negotiation skills
* Independent and Self-Motivated
* Excellent Customer Service Skills
* BSc in Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent


**Why you should join us:**
 Employees from more than 40 countries have chosen Radware as a place where they can belong.
   

  

 Radware has been recognized by Glassdoor and BDI as one of the World’s Best Places to Work, ranking among the top 100 companies across the globe in the IT category.
   

  

 Radware has also been named a Gold Winner for Application Security in the 2023 Globee Cybersecurity Awards, by Forrester a Leader in DDoS Protection, and has been named a Leader in WAF Market by Quadrant Knowledge Solutions.
   

  

 We are equally committed to our people. We strive to create a dynamic work environment that celebrates diversity, promotes equality, and thrives on the unique contributions of each individual.
   

  

 If you are ready to be part of a global-minded company that is inspired to create a better, safer future; and if and want to fight for the good guys and be at the forefront of helping companies protect their most critical assets from today’s cyber adversaries, then you’ve found the right fit at Radware.
   

  

**Primary Location**
 SE-Sweden
   

  

**Job**
 Technical Support

title: Marketing Automation Manager
description:
*Vill du leda teamet som säljer – med briljant kommunikation och smart automatisering? Här får du möjligheten att påverka kundresan, driva affärsvärde och utveckla dina medarbetare i en kultur där initiativ, innovation och resultat står i centrum.*
**Om rollen**
 Som Marketing Automation Manager hos oss på Tre får du en central roll i att forma hur vi kommunicerar med våra kunder – och hur kommunikationen skapar affärsvärde. Du leder ett engagerat och erfaret team som utvecklar automatiserade kundresor som inte bara stärker relationen – utan driver merköp, uppgradering, retention och livstidsvärde.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att ansvara för att skapa kundresor som inte bara engagerar utan verkligen konverterar, från onboarding till winback och uppgraderingsflöden. Du säkerställer att all kommunikation är mätbar, optimerad och tydligt kopplad till affärsmål som ARPU, churn, CLV, förlängning och aktivering. Tillsammans med sälj, affärsutveckling och analys omvandlar du data och insikter till kommunikation som får kunder att agera, samtidigt som du leder teamet i att testa, A/B-optimera och snabbt skala det som fungerar bäst.
   

  

 Du prioriterar initiativ utifrån affärsimpact – vad som säljer mest, behåller flest kunder och skapar mest värde – och ser till att varje aktivitet bidrar till Tres affärsmål.
   

  

**Du kan se fram emot att**
* Leda ett passionerat team med mandat att påverka hela kundresan och affärsresultatet.
* Utveckla automatiserade flöden som driver konvertering, retention och merförsäljning.
* Samarbeta med kollegor från hela organisationen för att skapa kommunikation som verkligen påverkar köpbeslut.
* Arbeta med moderna plattformar som Salesforce Marketing Cloud och tekniker som möjliggör hyperrelevant kommunikation i realtid.
* Vara en del av ett företag med en kultur präglad av innovation, initiativ och modet att testa nya idéer.
* Vara en del av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place To Work samt att vi är stolt samarbetspartner till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar


 ,
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du är en kommersiellt driven ledare med passion för datadriven kommunikation. Du ser marketing automation som en motor för affär och resultat, inte bara ett verktyg för kundrelationer. Du har erfarenhet av CRM/marketing automation och kan översätta KPI:er och data till handling och resultat. Detta har även gjort dig trygg i att kombinera omtanke om kunden med tydliga säljbudskap – och vet att det ena inte utesluter det andra.
   

  

 Du är analytisk och kreativ på samma gång, och har en naturlig förmåga att inspirera och coacha ditt team. Du vet hur man balanserar kundfokus med tydliga säljbudskap, och har erfarenhet av att arbeta med verktyg som Salesforce Marketing Cloud eller liknande. Rollen kräver att du är kommunikativ och kan uttrycka dig obehindrat på både svenska och engelska, då du kommer att samarbeta brett över organisationen.
   

  

 Hos oss på Tre får du möjligheten att driva verklig förändring, påverka strategier och skapa resultat som märks både för kunderna och för affären.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan**
 Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du bifogar CV och svarar på de frågor vi ställt nedan i samband med att du söker. Vi använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar i samband med urval. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Bakgrundskontroll görs på slutkandidat.

title: GenAI Engineer with backend experinece
description:
**About Arkus AI** 




 Arkus AI is on a mission to revolutionise medicine and healthcare through intelligent, AI-powered technologies. We are developing autonomous AI agents and a robust AI platform to support clinicians, researchers, and healthcare administrators in addressing some of the most complex challenges in medicine.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 We are looking for an engineer who can combine
 **GenAI expertise, backend development, and cloud engineering** 
 to enhance and scale our Agent Builder platform. You will work hands-on with
 **OpenAI models deployed on Azure** 
 , building multi-agent workflows and backend services that enable safe, reliable, healthcare-grade AI systems.
 



 This role sits at the core of our platform team, working on the foundation that lets
 **AI agents build and interact with other AI agents** 
 .
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 




**GenAI & Agent Engineering** 



* Develop and optimise prompts, system instructions, and multi-agent orchestration strategies
* Build reusable agent templates, persona definitions, and interaction protocols
* Evaluate and fine-tune agent performance for safety, consistency, and reasoning quality
* Integrate OpenAI models (Azure OpenAI Service) and tools in production systems



  





**Backend Engineering** 



* Design and maintain backend services supporting the Agent Builder (Python/FastAPI or Node.js)
* Implement integrations with Azure OpenAI, Azure Functions, Azure Storage, and vector databases
* Build pipelines for model evaluation, monitoring, and safety checks
* Ensure backend infrastructure is secure, scalable, and production-ready



  





**Collaboration & Product Development** 



* Work with product, research, clinical, and data teams to translate requirements into agentic workflows
* Prototype and experiment with new multi-agent capabilities
* Contribute to both early research prototypes and production-grade features



  





**Who You Are** 



* Experience with
 **LLMs, prompt engineering, or multi-agent systems**
* Strong backend engineering skills (Python/FastAPI, Node.js, or similar)
* Direct experience with Azure Functions, or Azure cloud services
* Familiarity with RAG, vector stores (e.g., Azure AI Search, Pinecone), and embeddings
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment
* Bonus: Experience in healthcare, digital health, life sciences, or regulated domains



  





**Why Join Arkus.ai?** 



* Work on technology that directly improves clinical workflows and patient outcomes
* Build cutting-edge, production-grade multi-agent systems with real-world impact
* Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team across AI, medicine, and engineering
* Contribute to a platform built on Azure and OpenAI that is shaping the future of intelligent healthcare
* High ownership, autonomy, and opportunity to influence the direction of our agent architecture

title: Security Engineer Detect & Response
description:
*Vi söker nu en Security Engineer med fokus på Endpoint- och sårbarhetsskydd till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.
 *Som Security Engineer med fokus på detect & response spelar du en central roll i att säkerställa skyddet för våra klient- och servermiljöer – på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och för varandra.**
 Som Security Engineer arbetar du operativt med att övervaka, förbättra och drifta säkerhetslösningar för våra endpoints – både klient- och servermiljöer – i syfte att upptäcka och hantera hot i ett tidigt skede. Du har en viktig roll i sårbarhetshantering, patchkoordination och teknisk efterlevnad, och verkar i nära samarbete med SIRT, driftorganisation och andra säkerhetsfunktioner.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär ansvar för lösningar som EDR, Vulnerability Management, loggplattformar och analysverktyg – samt deltagande i incidenthantering och säkerhetsutredningar. Du driver förbättringar av rutiner, dokumentation och tekniska kontroller, och arbetar kontinuerligt med att minska attackytor och öka motståndskraften i vår IT-miljö.
   

  

**Vem är du**
 Du har ett säkerhetstänk som spänner över både infrastruktur och applikation, och är van vid att arbeta i komplexa IT-miljöer med höga krav på säkerhet och tillgänglighet. Ditt arbetssätt präglas av struktur, analys och ett starkt fokus på att förebygga och hantera tekniska hot mot verksamheten.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med EDR-lösningar såsom Defender eller SentinelOne, och är bekväm med sårbarhetshantering och endpointskydd i både Windows- och Linuxmiljöer. Du har god förståelse för malwarebeteende, logganalys och incidentrespons, samt insikt i vilka säkerhetskrav som ställs på drift av klienter och servrar. Det är meriterande om du har certifieringar inom cybersäkerhet, såsom CompTIA Security+, GIAC eller CISSP.
   

  

**Mer information och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Jenny Nilsson: jenny.nilsson@nexergroup.com eller +46 703 018 279.
   

  

 Läs mer om tjänsten och ansök här.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
***Lösningsarkitekt***




  





**Placering:** 
 Solna
 



  





**Bli en del av Coop – tillsammans utvecklar vi framtidens butiksupplevelse!** 




  





***Om tjänsten***




 Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens IT-lösningar för Coops butiker? Som Lösningsarkitekt får du en central roll där du, tillsammans med leverantörer och andra arkitekter, ansvarar för att designa, dokumentera och hantera butikslösningarnas hela livscykel utifrån verksamhetens och myndigheters krav. Du säkerställer att våra standardplattformar, som SAP, Microsoft, ServiceNow och Azure, fungerar i samspel med butikernas system, tredjepartsprodukter och betallösningar.
 



  





 I ditt arbete samarbetar du nära såväl interna som externa parter för att ta fram lösningar som är säkra, kvalitativa och framtidssäkrade. Du engagerar dig i kravställning, dokumentation och planering för både pågående och framtida utvecklingsprojekt. Rollen innebär att du bidrar både strategiskt och operativt, där du snabbt sätter dig in i nya tekniker och processer för att möta verksamhetens behov och skapa bästa möjliga kundupplevelse.
 



  





**Som Lösningsarkitekt kommer du bland annat att:** 



* Designa och dokumentera IT-lösningar för Coops butiker
* Säkerställa säkerhet, kvalitet och efterlevnad av myndighetskrav och IT-policy
* Samarbeta med leverantörer, partners, andra arkitekter och applikationsledare
* Deltaga i förändrings- och utvecklingsarbete, både kort- och långsiktigt
* Planera och dokumentera för framtida förflyttningar och nya förmågor inom området
* Bidra till utvecklingsprojekt och snabbt ta till dig ny teknik



  





 I rollen blir du en viktig del av ett engagerat team med bred teknisk kompetens och nära koppling till butiksdriften. Här får du möjlighet att påverka, samarbeta och bidra till Coops fortsatta digitala resa.
 



  





***Vem är du?***




 Vi söker dig som har förståelse för butikslösningar och erfarenhet av att arbeta med IT i retailmiljö. Du har troligen en akademisk utbildning inom teknik/IT, eller har på annat sätt skaffat dig motsvarande kvalificerade kunskaper genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
 



  





 Du är en problemlösare som trivs i en komplex verksamhet där IT och affär går hand i hand. Du har lätt för att samarbeta, kommunicera och skapa relationer, både med tekniska specialister och personer utan teknisk bakgrund. Du är van att arbeta självständigt, prioritera och hantera flera projekt samtidigt.
 



  





**Vi ser gärna att du har:** 



* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av liknande arbete inom IT, teknik eller butikslösningar
* Erfarenhet av SAP, kassasystem och integrationer i butiksmiljö
* God förståelse för affärsprocesser och butiksdrift
* Förmåga att omsätta strategier till konkreta handlingsplaner
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med standardplattformar och integrationer (t.ex. Azure, Microsoft)
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift



  





***Vårt erbjudande till dig:***




 Hos Coop får du vara med och utveckla framtidens butiksupplevelse i en miljö där innovation, samarbete och kundfokus står i centrum. Du blir en del av ett kompetent och engagerat team där du får möjlighet att påverka och växa – nära verksamheten och med stor variation i arbetsuppgifterna.
 



  





**Så ansöker du:** 




 Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, då vi arbetar löpande med urval och intervjuer.
 



  





 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande ledare Tove Nilsson, på e-post Tove.Nilsson@coop.se
 



  





**Om företaget** 




**För en hållbar framtid tillsammans:** 




 Coop är Sveriges största kooperation och en ledande aktör inom dagligvaruhandeln, med över 4 miljoner medlemmar. Vi har ett stort fokus på hållbarhet och arbetar för att skapa en mer grön och rättvis framtid genom att erbjuda hållbara produkter och tjänster.
 



  





 Vi tror på att en mångfald av perspektiv och erfarenheter är nyckeln till att skapa en mer inkluderande och framgångsrik arbetsplats. Därför välkomnar vi alla oavsett kön, ålder, bakgrund och etnisk tillhörighet.
 



  





  





**Kontaktperson** 




 Tove Nilsson
 



 Tove.Nilsson@coop.se

title: Senior konsult Digital Workplace
description:
Atea i Södertälje växer – vill du vara med från start?
 



 Vi har spännande kundavtal på plats och söker dig som är senior konsult som trivs i en fri roll med stort inflytande. Med din passion, tillsammans med dina ambitiösa kollegor, kunder och leverantörer, skapar vi The Place To Be – stället där alla vill vara. Tillsammans bygger vi upp konsultgruppen och skapar något riktigt bra i Södertälje – missa inte denna spännande och utvecklande möjlighet!
 



  





**Din roll** 




 Det här är en unik möjlighet för dig som vill utmana dig själv i en roll där kundrelationer och teknik står i centrum. I rollen som senior konsult inom Digital Workplace kommer du att sätta dig in i och förstå kundernas verksamhet, behov och utmaningar samt att lösa problem och fokusera på kundnytta. Du kommer ha ett stort ansvar som rådgivare kring den digitala arbetsplatsen och arbeta med allt från planering, design, implementation, migrering, utveckling till förvaltning av olika delar inom Digital Workplace. I rollen tar du även en unik position där syftet är att stärka och bygga konsultgruppens kapacitet där du får chansen att tillsammans med konsultchefen bygga konsultfunktionen från grunden och forma arbetssätt och relationer som driver hela teamet och verksamheten framåt.
 



  





 Martin Hedqvist, Konsultchef på Atea i Södertälje, kommer att vara din närmsta chef i rollen. Med över 8 års erfarenhet av kompetensförsörjning sätter han ett fokus på trivsel och utveckling på jobbet.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Som person har du förutom den tekniska kompetensen ett personligt driv och problemlösande synsätt där fokus alltid ligger på att ta fram bästa lösning till kunden. Du har en positiv inställning till förändring och tycker om att skapa långsiktiga och goda relationer där du trivs med att ta kontakt med kunder. Vi ser att du är en person som tar ansvar för dina uppgifter, strukturerar ditt arbete självständigt och driver dina processer framåt. Vi tror att du håller dig kontinuerligt uppdaterad kring vad som händer och har koll på det senaste inom området.
 



  





 För rollen som senior konsult inom Digital Workplace ser vi gärna att du har:
 


* Flertalet års erfarenhet av arbete med Digital Workplace och erfarenhet av att implementera, migrera och utveckla produkter inom såsom exempelvis M365, Exchange, AD, IAM, Entra ID, MIM, EMS, MEM, Sharepoint, Intune, Defender eller Purview
* Obehindrad i svenska och engelska, både tal och skrift
* B-körkort



  





**Om Atea** 




 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av it-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med it och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara it-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar it-värld.
 



  





 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" – en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
 



  





**Kontakt & mer information** 




 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Martin Hedqvist, Konsultchef, via martin.hedqvist@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och ansök därmed redan idag.
 



 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll för vissa av våra tjänster, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
 



 Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.
 



**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!** 




  





*Den här rekryteringen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför samtal och mail från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag* 
 .
 



**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Senior Partner Sales Manager
description:
**About Workato**
 Workato transforms technology complexity into business opportunity. As the leader in enterprise orchestration, Workato helps businesses globally streamline operations by connecting data, processes, applications, and experiences. Its AI-powered platform enables teams to navigate complex workflows in real-time, driving efficiency and agility.
   

  

 Trusted by a community of 400,000 global customers, Workato empowers organizations of every size to unlock new value and lead in today’s fast-changing world. Learn how Workato helps businesses of all sizes achieve more at workato.com.
   

  

**Why join us?**
 Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a
 **flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles** 
 . We are driven by
 **innovation** 
 and looking for
 **team players** 
 who want to actively build our company.
   

  

 But, we also believe in
 **balancing productivity with self-care** 
 . That’s why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.
   

  

 If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!
   

  

**Also, Feel Free To Check Out Why**
* Business Insider named us an “enterprise startup to bet your career on”
* Forbes’ Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world
* Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America
* Quartz ranked us the #1 best company for remote workers


**Responsibilities**
 We are looking for an exceptional
 **Senior** 
**Partner Manager** 
 to join our European channel team. In this role, you will be involved in managing existing partners in the territory as well as recruiting new partners that support the
 **Nordic channel strategy.**
**You Will Also Be Responsible To**
* Create, own and execute a Nordic Channel Plan that will drive a “co-market, co-sell and co-delivery” motion, ensuring that we are consistently growing our mindshare and visibility in the territory with new logos and upsell opportunities.
* Manage our most important partnership relationships in the territory in, both existing and new partners, own executive-level relationships whilst executing strategically important partnership initiatives, aligned with the territory strategy.
* Recruit new partnerships that provide incremental opportunity to Workato in the territory and coordinate due diligence processes with those prospective partners and project-manage internal stakeholders through commercial, product and systems assessment.
* Understand the competitive landscape to ensure that Workato remains a ‘partner-of-choice’ and proactively present recommendations of how to stimulate business growth to executive management.
* Position yourself as an industry expert and establish relationships with potential partners and key decision-makers in the industry, attend industry events and present the benefits of the Workaro platform where required.
* You will serve as a regional expert while keeping in mind our global footprint.
* Strong familiarity with leading CRM and PRM tools and the discipline to keep these systems accurate and up to date with key business information.


**Requirements**
**Qualifications / Experience / Technical Skills**
* Proven 10+ years experience in sales / indirect / channel partnerships, or equivalent direct Sales experience.
* You have a minimum of 5-6 years of experience in a partnership role.
* A strong understanding of the iPaaS and Automation industry is desirable or enterprise software platforms.
* You are an exceptional communicator – being able to connect with people at all levels, both internally and with external stakeholders, and communicate project expectations effectively is critical.


**Soft Skills / Personal Characteristics**
* You thrive under pressure, have high levels of productivity and work well with constant change and the ambiguity of a high growth business environment supported by an established HQ.
* You have strong negotiation skills – to navigate complex commercial discussions to ensure the best outcome for Workato.
* You have a strong network - of partners, experts and executives you have worked with over the years in a primarily partnerships role.


**(REQ ID: 2266)**

title: Senior AI Platform Engineer to Handelsbanken
description:
Join Handelsbanken’s Advanced Analytics & AI department as a Senior AI Platform Engineer and help shape the future of Sweden’s most trusted bank. You’ll build and operate cutting-edge data, machine learning, and GenAI capabilities that power data-driven insights and solutions that make a real impact on our customers and colleagues.
   

  

**Your team**
 We’re on a mission to lead the industry in advanced analytics and AI, delivering smarter products, services, and experiences for our customers. Our cross-functional team, consisting of Data and Platform Engineers and a Product Manager, combines deep technical expertise with a passion for innovation. Together, we design scalable solutions that leverage statistics, machine learning, and GenAI to solve real business challenges across the bank.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Senior AI Platform Engineer, you’ll be key in developing and maintaining our hybrid data platforms. You’ll use your expertise to design efficient data and machine learning pipelines that serve as the foundation for our AI initiatives. Our environments span both on-premises and cloud platforms, so you should enjoy hands-on engineering, especially in Linux environments — bonus points if you prefer working in the terminal.
   

  

 We believe DevOps and solid software engineering practices are essential to delivering AI in production, enabling branch offices and business teams to use the insights and models we create. You’ll collaborate closely with Data Engineers, ML Engineers, and Data Scientists to ensure our platforms are robust, scalable, and ready for innovation. If you’re a seasoned engineer who enjoys working end-to-end, from data sourcing and transformation to operationalising models, and want to advance CI/CD and ML pipelines in a complex environment, this is a great opportunity to make a real impact.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You have several years of professional experience as a Data, DevOps, Software, or ML Engineer and hold a university degree in a technical field with strong academic results. You’re skilled in software development, with knowledge in Python and SQL, and have a strong understanding of system design.
   

  

 You’ve built and maintained data pipelines, ideally using tools such as dbt, Prefect, or Spark, and you’re experienced with containerised development in Linux. You’re familiar with deploying or supporting ML models in production environments (MLOps) and apply test-driven development practices in your work. You are willing to learn, or already have, Swedish language skills. Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform or Ansible is a plus.
   

  

 As a person, you have excellent problem-solving skills and enjoy tackling challenges with code. You’re curious and inventive, continuously striving to learn and improve. You share our commitment to being smart, humble, and, above all, collaborative.
   

  

**Why join Handelsbanken**
 At Handelsbanken, you’ll join a stable, values-driven organisation that invests long-term in people and technology. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to our AI transformation, in an environment that values trust, collaboration, and sustainable innovation.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application**
*As part of Handelsbanken’s recruitment process, candidates who progress to the next stage will be asked to complete a logical reasoning and personality test. The final candidate is also required to undergo and successfully pass a background check conducted by an external provider before employment can be offered.*
**Contact details**
**Recruiting manager:** 
 Johan Helldahl, johan.helldahl@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Talent Acquisition Partner:** 
 Alva Jonerot, alva.jonerot@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Union representative Finansförbundet:** 
 Per Almshult, per.almshult@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Union representative Akademikerföreningen:** 
 Bjarne Nilsson, bjarne.nilsson@handelsbanken.se

title: Senior .NET/Optimizely Developer
description:

 A well-respected Swedish digital solutions provider is looking for experienced
 **Senior .NET / Optimizely Developers** 
 to join their growing team. The company builds modern, user-centric platforms for mission-driven organisations across both the public and private sector, with a strong focus on quality, accessibility, and long-term value.

 In this position, you will help design, develop, and evolve solutions using
 **Optimizely CMS** 
 and the
 **.NET platform** 
 . You’ll work closely with UX designers, project managers, and clients from initial needs analysis and architecture through to development and continuous improvement.
 



  





 The work is meaningful, technically challenging, and central to delivering secure, accessible, and user-focused digital services.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Develop and enhance digital solutions in
 **Optimizely CMS / DXP**
* Build backend functionality using
 **C# / .NET**
* Work on integrations and frontend components (HTML, CSS, JS, React/Next)
* Ensure accessibility, security, and performance best practices

**What You’ll Need**

 in .NET development (Optimizely strongly preferred)

**What’s Offered** 




 ⭐ A highly competent, supportive team with a collaborative culture
 



 ⭐ Opportunities to work on impactful, well-known client projects
 



 ⭐ Training and certifications in Optimizely and related technologies
 



 ⭐ A values-driven workplace focused on knowledge sharing, development, and enjoyment
 



  





**We are looking for to hire on both a permanent and contract basis for these positions.** 
 This is a hybrid working arrangement in Stockholm.
 **Swedish fluency is required.** 




  





**Please apply via the Easy Apply function.** 




  





**For more information, please email t.collard-gentle@tenthrevolution.com.** 




  





**The application deadline for this position is the 15th of December, 2025. However, applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis so please apply quickly.**

title: Android Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* You should have over 5 years of experience working with Android development.
* Have a great knowledge of UI, common design patterns, and tests.
* Professional English, both verbal and written.
* Kotlin experience.
* Work with internal and external stakeholders.
* Improve infrastructure.
* Work and improve app architecture.


**Application deadline:** 
 01-12-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Systemintegratör | Transmission & Nätverk
description:
*Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? Vi söker nu en självgående och* 
 serviceinriktad
 *systemintegratör med specialistkunskaper inom transmission och nätverk. På FRA är varje arbetsuppgift en del av något större. Är du den vi söker kan vi erbjuda ett varierande arbete i en kunskapsintensiv miljö där du får vara med och göra skillnad varje dag.*
**Ditt uppdrag**
 Som systemintegratör inom transmission och nätverk hör du till avdelningen för teknik som har till uppgift att förse FRA med de tekniska system som behövs för verksamheten. Avdelningen utvecklar, förvaltar och driftsätter nya tekniska system och sköter drift och underhåll av befintliga system.
   

  

 I Rollen Som Systemintegratör Arbetar Du i En Komplex Och Varierad IT‑miljö Med Stora Möjligheter Att Fördjupa Dina Kunskaper Inom Teknik Och System, Samtidigt Som Du Får Verka Med Frihet Under Ansvar. Du Blir En Del Av Ett Team Med Olika Expertkompetenser, Där Ni Tillsammans Har Ett Betydande Inflytande Över Hur Den Gemensamma Uppgiften Ska Lösas. Rollen Innebär Många Kontaktytor Både Inom Myndigheten Och Mot Externa Aktörer. Ditt Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområde Omfattar Följande Områden
   

  

* Projektering, installation, konfigurering, drift av DWDM- och nätverksutrustning
* Dokumentation av system
* Kravställning och inköpsunderlag för förhyrda förbindelser


**Du kan**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom telekommunikation, alternativt förvärvat motsvarande kompetens genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av arbete i en relevant gren av IT‑sektorn exempelvis hos en telekomoperatör eller dess underleverantörer.
* Goda kunskaper om fibertransmission/DMDW-system samt praktisk erfarenhet av planering, drift och felsökning av sådana
* Goda kunskaper om nätverk (IP, routing, switching)
* Kunskaper om Linux
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska i såväl tal som skrift
* Goda kunskaper i engelska i såväl tal som skrift och en förmåga att obehindrat kunna läsa teknisk dokumentation på engelska
* B-körkort


**Vi Ser Det Som Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet inom underrättelsetjänst
* Kunskaper om satellitkommunikation


**Du är**
**Vi Söker Dig Med Följande Egenskaper**
* Helhetssyn: Ser helheter och tar hänsyn till det större perspektivet. Förstår sin roll, men ser till hela verksamhetens bästa i agerande och beslut.
* Strukturerad: Planerar, organiserar och prioriterar arbetet på ett effektivt sätt. Sätter upp och håller tidsramar.
* Självgående: Tar ansvar för sin uppgift. Strukturerar själv sitt angreppssätt och driver sina processer vidare.
* Serviceinriktad: Är lugn, uppmärksam och tillmötesgående i sitt bemötande. Har intresse, vilja och förmåga att hjälpa andra och anstränger sig för att leverera lösningar.


**Om FRA**
 FRA har omvärlden som sin arena där varje arbetsuppgift är en del av något större. På ett eller annat sätt får du som medarbetare vara med och bidra till att skydda Sveriges integritet och oberoende i världen. Du är med och gör skillnad på riktigt, varje dag.
   

  

 Vår uppgift som underrättelsetjänst är att skydda Sverige mot de allvarligaste hot som kan riktas mot ett samhälle – militära angrepp, terrorism och cyberattacker. Vi skyddar det viktigaste vi har – vår trygghet, vår demokrati och vårt sätt att leva. Vi är experter på cyberområdet och signalspaning samt en larmklocka för militära hot.
   

  

 FRA leder sedan 2024 Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter, NCSC vars uppdrag är att utveckla och stärka Sveriges förmåga att förebygga, upptäcka och hantera cyberhot.
   

  

 Som nyanställd på FRA får du en omfattande introduktionsutbildning och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, vilket ger dig möjlighet att utveckla dina färdigheter och bli ännu bättre på det du brinner för. Vår organisation är mångfacetterad och består av olika kompetenser och personligheter, där varje individ har unika egenskaper och förutsättningar. Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla känner sig välkomna och trygga. Utöver en stimulerande arbetsmiljö erbjuder vi också ett attraktivt förmånspaket, som du kan läsa mer om på www.fra.se . För mer information om Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter besök www.ncsc.se
   

  

 För din trygghet. För vår demokrati. Varje dag. Året om.
   

  

**Mer information**
 Arbetsplatsen är belägen i närheten av Drottningholm, ca 10 min från Brommaplan. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då anställning vid FRA innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för att få anställning är godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprövningen kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. I denna rekryteringsprocess kommer arbetsprov/tester att tillämpas. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef på rekrytering@fra.se. Fackliga företrädare nås på 010-557 46 00.
   

  

 Vi tar emot ansökningar via www.fra.se
 **senast 2025-12-14**
 Referensnummer
 **2025FRA1614-4**
 Då vi inför denna rekrytering redan tagit ställning till de rekryteringskanaler vi önskar använda undanber vi oss att bli kontaktade för ytterligare erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.

title: Backend Developer (Go)
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. Our growth is made possible by the dedicated team of hundreds behind the scenes. From software developers and product managers to designers and strategists, Team UI is driven to achieve our common goal: Rethinking IT. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons - all while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**Join forces with us on our mission to build a better IT industry. We are currently looking for a highly skilled Backend Developer (Go) to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Develop efficient, scalable, and maintainable backend services
* Develop integrations with network device firmware and other applications
* Integrate feature designs with larger software systems
* Co-work with cloud architects, backend developers, frontend developers, designers, and other stakeholders


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience with Golang is required
* Experience with RDBMS and NoSQL
* Experience with developing REST and MQTT API
* Experience with Git/GitHub
* Experience with Linux and Docker environments
* Good understanding of SOLID principles
* Ability to work independently
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong sense of ownership of tasks and responsibilities
* Highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Familiarity with Java development
* Experience with Spring or other web framework knowledge
* Knowledge of Bash and Unix
* Knowledge of WebRTC and WebSockets
* Good understanding of networking protocols and architectures
* Experience developing AWS cloud services / DevOps
* Experience with SD-WAN and/or VPN technologies
* Familiarity with the Agile software development processes


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***
